30.name: Clove-Black
30.description:
Clove-Black is a gothic theme for Cinnamon. It is a remix of dark-glass theme and Minty theme, with some tweaks made by me. The panel background is inspired DarkCold's panel.
 
Clove-Black is compatible with Cinnamon 2.0
 
Please report issues or suggestions here.
 
Installation
 
You can install from the repository .
 
sudo apt-get-respositry ppa:mordant23/themes
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install cinnamon-theme-clove-black 
 
Extract zip file and to the themes directory. That's usually /usr/share/themes/ for system wide installation or ~/.themes/ for a specific user.
 
Use Cinnamon Settings to choose the theme.
Restart Cinnamon by pressing "Alt+F2".
Type "r" and then press Enter.
You can install from the zipball.
 
Extract zip file and the themes directory. That's usually /usr/share/themes/ for system wide installation or ~/.themes/ for a specific user.
 
Use Cinnamon Settings to choose the theme.
Restart Cinnamon by pressing "Alt+F2".
Type "r" and then press Enter.
 
Changelog
2.0 2013-12-03
updated theme to be compatible with Cinnamon 2.0
1.0 2011-02-02
Initial release
 
License
 
cinnamon/overview.png cinnamon/overview-hover.png /menu.png: Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 Unported
 
cinnamon/thumbail.png: Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported
 
Everything else: GPL 3
Clove-

Installation

sudo apt-apt-respositry ppa:mordant23/themes
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install orta-cinnamon-light-theme
 
You can also install from the zipball.
 
Extract zip file to the themes directory. Theme directory is usually:
 
/usr/share/themes for system wide installation or
 
~/.themes for individual installation
 
After installation, use Cinnamon Settings to choose Orta.

54.name: Coffee Stain
54.description:
This is my first shot at re-designing a theme. I based this off of the "chocolatte" theme, and give credit/thanks to it's maker.  I am super excited to get to see the Cinnamon community grow, and to get to be a part of it. I am also working on dock themes, but it is taking a while. I will have more updates when I get the free time. 

UPDATE(2/3/2012)

I changed to a better screenshot. It is easier to see the panel/menu/dock theme now. Also, this:

I have included a mild theming of the regular dock. I'm not sure if it will work for the Cinnadock extension, but I made it using the regular Dock@Cinnamon.org extension, so I know it works with that.  To install the dock aspect of the theme, simply paste the "stylesheet.css" file into /usr/share/cinnamon/extensions/dock@cinnamon.org folder, or wherever you keep your dock extension. Here's the kicker:

*****PLEASE MAKE A BACKUP OF THE ORIGINAL FILE BEFORE REPLACING IT*****

Sorry for the "yelling," but I am trying to make sure the point it clear. If you don't back up the original file, you will be unable to revert back from the dock theme, unless you happen to go into the file and change it manually.

 

I'm still working on all of this, and should have more updates soon.  Feel free to leave comments/questions/requests, and let me know what you think. Thanks,

 

D

hope you like this !

 

if you wish to have elementary icon in place of menu icon, use cinnamon settings to choose the menu-elementary.png from the cinnamon folder and keep the text area as black.

thank you for visiting this page for a preview / download.

suggested Icon: Elementary OR OSX (OSX is preferred as the folders match the Mac like gtk3 while the documents / navigation buttons match the Elementary)

57.description:

id like to think its a little more refined but there might be bugs. but personally im very happy with it. the colours are inspired by the hope gtk theme by grvrulz and the ubuntu ambiance theme (yes im an ubuntu refugee that couldnt cope with unity and loves cinnamon)

included is also a modded gtk and metacity theme based on the hope gtk theme mentioned above. i think this gtk/metacity matches the cinnamon theme very nicely

-Changed Workspace OSD to look better and fit theme more elegantly

Version 1.0:

-Provided better Window List colors and panel integration.

-Fixed notifications color to fit the theme.

-Fixed workspace switcher theme to fit the theme and enhance visibility.

78.name: Minty Colors
78.description:
Minty Colors is a chameleon theme for Cinnamon. It can change colors according to the current GTK theme, current wallpaper (uses imagemagick to get color) or a user defined color. Also various other aspects of the theme are customizable.

 
A process runs in the background which detects any change and reloads the theme accordingly. Everything will be automatic.
 
You can launch the GUI from the menu which lets you customise various aspects of the the theme. It will take few seconds for the changes to be applied.
 
The configuration file is automatically created and replaced every time you change the configuration. It should not be edited by hand.
 
---
 
Linux Mint/Ubuntu users can install Minty Colors from our themes PPA using the following commands,
 
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:satyajit-happy/themes
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install cinnamon-theme-minty-colors
 
If you don't use Linux Mint/Ubuntu, you need to compile from source. This is needed for the GUI. I could have provided a precompiled binary. But due to architecture differences, the GUI might not run on your distro.
 
Don't worry, it is easy and straight forward.
 
You will need to install the build-dependencies first (package names may vary depending on your distro),
 
glib2-devel gtk3-devel vala
 
Extract the archive, navigate to the directory and type the following commands in a terminal,
 
make
sudo make install
 
To make "Match wallpaper color" work, you will need to install ImageMagick
 
After installation, run "minty-colors" from the terminal to start the process. the process will start in background, so you won't see any outputs. It will also make a theme basing upon the template and default configuration.
 
Use Cinnamon Settings to choose the theme, or run the following commands in Terminal,
 
gsettings set org.cinnamon.theme name "minty-colors"
 
It will usually take few seconds to apply new configuration. When applying the new configuration, the theme is reloaded, and Cinnamon may freeze if you do things really fast when reloading the theme.
 
---
 
Troubleshooting:
 
To view any error messages produced, stop the background process first and then run the process in Terminal,
 
minty-colors stop
minty-colors start
 
---
 
License: GPL

123.name: DeLorean-Dark (for Cinnamon-1.6)
123.description:
The Dark Brushed Metal Theme

for LinuxMint Maya 13 (Gnome-3.4) and Cinnamon-1.60

Theme supports Nemo-File-Manager!

Fixes:

Should you experience problems with window opening and closing animation the fix is to remove the 'metacity-theme-3.xml' file from the included 'metacity-1' folder.

Theme includes:

  • Cinnamon Theme
  • Gtk2 & Gtk3 Themes
  • Metacity 2 & 3 Themes
  • Gnome-Shell Theme
  • GDM-3 Theme
  • Xfwm4 Theme
  • Openbox3 Theme

Requirements of Gtk2 & Gtk3:

  • Gnome 3.4 *if you are using the Gnome Desktop
  • Gtk3-3.4*
  • gkt-engine-equinox-1.50
  • gtk-engine-murrine-0.98.1.1(or newer)
  • pixbuf-engine or the gtk(2)-engines package
  • gnome-themes-standard-3.4.*(provides the 'adwaita' theme)
  • gtk-engine-unico-1.0.2*

Here you can find downloads for matching Firefox-theme, Thunderbird-theme, Chromium-theme, and Qt(Kde apps)-theme.

*as of version 1.54, the Firefox-Scrollbar-Fix is necessary, unless using Ubuntu w/overlay-scrollbars.  It can be found on the Firefox-Theme page.

Also available by PPA:

Copy and Paste the following in a terminal~

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:killhellokitty/themes.ppa
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install delorean-dark

*If you are using ArchLinux, Fedora-17, or openSUSE-12.2  repos are available on my web-page.

v1.1

Original theme updates

125.name: nightfall (a compact theme)
125.description:
ok started from scratch with the default cinnamon 1.6 theme as template. hopefully this theme is now 1.6 compatible, i dont know

i must say that there are many things in cinnamon i dont use, for example expo and multiple workspaces, and many things i dont even know how to activate (on screen keyboard for example) so it may be that such things arent really in style with the rest of the theme. if so they probably look like the default cinnamon 1.6 theme. the same might be the case with much of the new stuff introduced in 1.6, because i dont use them or dont know how to activate them, or most likely, i have no clue what those things are

 

-its probably best to not use customized panel size in cinnamon-settings with this theme...

-using boxpointer arrows dont seem to work with shadows under menus and without the arrows the menus appear midway under the button clicked. annoying. but shadows under menus are to me much more important (maybe clem or someone has an idea how to fix this?)

-theres bound to be bugs. maybe ill fix them some day

 

 

#####old description####

a compact theme with shadows under menus

shadows inspired by DeLorean-Dark by jo-shva

compactness inspired by jelly bean by debimint

(might have stolen some code from the above themes as well)

otherwise this theme evolved from my old themes

gtk themes also included, that more or less match

140.name: Atarax
140.description:
A minimalistic black theme for Cinnamon 1.6 (zip file includes version 1.4).
No support for right to left writing yet.

I collected the classes for this style sheet from all the themes of the cinnamon-themes package, and many are still unused, probably because they are out-dated or provide features for Gnome Shell or future versions of Cinnamon. So I left them in the file for now. I added short descriptions of the various classes I could identify.

I documented my findings of problems with Cinnamon in brief comments in the cinnamon.css file.

So enjoy the theme and give me feedback of praise and criticism.

 

CHANGELOG

1.6-1

  • Theme updated for Cinnamon 1.6
  • Looking glass: made tabs more consistent
  • Looking glass: added some styles

1.4-7

  • Cleared up code

1.4-6

  • Cinnamon menu: In the final battle of the vertical alignment war against applet.js the author was victorious!

1.4-5

  • Cinnamon menu: Fixed application buttons being cut off by scrollbar
  • Fixed bullet size

1.4-4

  • Cinnamon menu: Fixed vertical alignment of application labels again
  • On-screen keyboard: Subkeys container now with boxpointer
  • Notifications: Polished styles
  • Sound applet: Polished styles

1.4-3

  • Cinnamon menu: Fixed vertical alignment of application labels
  • Cinnamon menu: Fixed expansion of applications container on selection

1.4-2

  • Cinnamon menu: Workaround for the problem that the main container and applications container share the same style class (.menu-applications-box)

127.name: Tout
127.description:
(Works with 1.6 and 1.4.)

This began with me, as a layman, wanting to change the Ubuntu font from the Cinnamon theme Baldr as I didn't like the presence of Ubuntu branding on a Mint desktop. I then started poking around with the hope of making the panel backgound more distinct, with a border (as to me a mere gradient or colour looks unfinished) and removing the boxes from both the panel and menus, which looked murky on my screen.

Hope my efforts are found to be clean, attractive and readable.

149.name: FlatStudio Light
149.description:
We spend more of our time in applications than looking at our desktops. Here's a very solid, minimalistic, "flat"-looking theme to go along with those applications, for minimal distraction and maximum consistency.

It's designed to match and fit in well with Rafa Cobreros' FlatStudio Light GTK theme and goes along great with Jakub Jankiewicz' Clarity icon theme.

[Known issues]:

  • Sound applet may not be themed well. Sorry, but I've removed Pulseaudio and thus don't get that applet. I will work on getting a VM up soon to have a better model for reference, but for now I just want to get this update out there. Song seek sliders should work, of course.
  • There may be some miscellaneous theming issues in areas that I've overlooked. If you come across anything, please report it below in the comments.

[To-Do]:

  • Update for Cinnamon 1.9/2.0
  • Catch up on suggestions
  • Improve sound menu
  • Make FlatStudio Dark Cinnamon theme

[Manual install instructions]:
Extract the "FlatStudioLight Cinnamon" folder and place it in the .themes directory within your home folder.

It is very much recommended to get the GTK and icon themes to match.

[GTK Theme]:
http://gnome-look.org/content/show.php/FlatStudio?content=154296

[Icon Theme]:
http://gnome-look.org/content/show.php?content=135654


Also, you can get the "GTK+ Native" Firefox theme if you have Firefox, for added consistency:
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-us/firefox/addon/gtk-native/

Wallpaper credit goes to Wallpaperstock:
http://img.wallpaperstock.net:81/black-and-white-abstract-wallpapers_35293_1440x900.jpg

Font credit goes to M Janet Mars for Metropolische and PrimaFont for Exmouth

[News]:

  • July 3, 2013 - Theme updated for Cinnamon 1.8
  • Jan. 19, 2013 - Theme renamed from "GrayScale" to "FlatStudio Light Cinnamon"
  • Dec. 26, 2012 - Theme updated for Cinnamon 1.6
  • Dec. 24, 2012 - Initial release

[Changes]:

Version 0.5.4 [Latest release] - July 8, 2013

  • Fixed Looking Glass code inspector theming
  • Fixed expo close area theming
  • Minor code cleanup
  • Further improved icons
     

Version 0.5.3 - July 8, 2013

  • Fixed ".popup-combo-menu" theming. Overview/scale should now have right-click menus that match the rest of the theme
  • New window/workspace close icons. Not perfect yet, but should match the rest of the theme better
     

Version 0.5.2 - July 8, 2013

  • Popup menus now match 98%
  • Cinnamon menu "padding" issue fixed (Classic border problem... Not that border problem :P)


Version 0.5.1 - July 3, 2013

  • Removed extra files not used with Cinnamon 1.8
  • Improved PolicyKit dialog theming


Version 0.5 - July 3, 2013

  • Updated for Cinnamon 1.8
  • Improved on-screen keyboard theming
  • Improved Looking Glass theming
  • Improved fonts - now uses Sans-Serif instead of Droid Sans
  • Removed shadows for extra flatness. All hail the flatness
  • Removed transition animations due to apparent bug - see "Known Issues" for details
  • Various misc. improvements, code cleanup


Version 0.4 - Jan. 19, 2013

  • End session dialog now matches rest of theme
  • Improved expo background and label colors


Version 0.3 - Dec. 26, 2012

  • Updated for Cinnamon 1.6
  • Changed switch icons to match better


Version 0.21 - Dec. 25, 2012

  • Some misc. tweaks
  • Scrollbars now match GTK theme
     

Version 0.2 - Dec. 25, 2012

  • Tray icons, notifications, and alt+tab switcher now match overall theme


Version 0.1 - Dec. 24, 2012

  • Initial release

142.name: Flatty
142.description:
A clean, well-proportioned dark theme designed to fit with the default appearance settings in Mint or Ubuntu.

Tested on Cinnamon 1.6.4 and 1.4
 
Comes with 3 styles of taskbar:
- All flat color
- A subtle shadow effect
- Icons only, no titles
 
The third style might work better with larger taskbar icons but nothing I changed in the theme file seemed to do it. Anyone know a way?
 
Uses altered versions of svg files from Bimsebasse's Ambiance theme
 
 
Updates:
 
1.1  Flattened & greyscaled the calendar, greyscaled Looking Glass, fixed some small bugs
Tested 
Tested on Cinnamon 1.6.4 and 1.4A dark flat theme designed to be as clean as possible and to fit with the default appearance settings in Mint or Ubuntu.
 
I used Bimsebasse's Ambiance theme as a starting point so some credit goes to him. I'm new to this theme making stuff so apologies if I'm breaking etiquette by altering someone else's theme.
 
 
 
Comes with 3 styles of taskbar:
 
- Flatty flat (all flat color)
 
- Flatty flakes (has some shadows)
 
- Flatty titleless (icons only, no titles)
 
The third style was really just an experiment and probably isn't very practical for most people. Wanted to slightly increase the taskbar icon size but couldn't find a css property that would do it. Does anyone know a way?
 
 
 
Tested on Cinnamon 1.6.4 and 1.4

180.name: Solarized-Dark
180.description:
This theme uses the Solarized color pallet by Ethan Schoonover.  I use "Source Code Pro" for the font to give it more of a terminal feel.  You can get it from Google Fonts if you don't have it.  Otherwise, you'll see the default sans.  I've included the menu icon in the cinnamon folder.

I started with the default theme and tried to polish it up a bit with some unique details and icons.  I hope to add more transitions as I get to know Cinnamon's css classes a bit better.  

This is my first Cinnamon Theme so feedback and suggestions are much appreciated.

 

INSTALLATION

Extract the downloaded zip into "/.usr/share/themes/"   or  "~/.themes/"

266.name: StarkNight
266.description:
This theme was ment to go with the "MediterraneanNight Series" Theme:

http://gnome-look.org/content/show.php/?content=156782

 
Also one minor issue I noticed amongst many themes was that Panel items where not consistent with sizes, hover effects, padding, etc. S0 this theme was aimed at trying to get those more consistent.
 

I personally don't like items in the panel touching the bottom.  I like them with the same padding as the top. So by default the panel Height is set to 33px.  However this creates a small side affect, you wont be able to slide your mouse along the very bottom of the screen to select an item.  You will need to be a few pixels above.  This doesn't bother me at all, but I know it might bother others.  So if that is the case for you then you can change the Panel Settings and force set the Panel hieght to 30px.

274.name: Mint-X-White
274.description:
* Created by MrVaykadji
        * Based on Mint-X, Linux Mint, Void
        * Version : 0.2 (2 jan 2014)
        * http://cinnamon-spices.linuxmint.com/themes/view/274


Mint-X-White is a clean and smooth theme, with dominance of White and Green.
It is designed to fully theme Cinnamon 2.0 (Linux Mint 16 Petra)

Mint-X-White can theme :
    - Cinnamon 2.0 Panel, Menu, Applets, Desklets (Navbar)
    - GTK theme (Main windows)
    - Metacity (Window manager)

    
             Please leave feedback if you like or
                 dislike this theme, so I'll know
            what I will improve on the next release.
 

Installation : ~/.themes
- launch "install.sh" to make Mint-X-White the default theme for GTK-Metacity-Cinnamon if you want to have the same theme on root and non-root windows.

- you can also download and install it direclty in one command-line :

wget http://ubuntuone.com/1if0NvIaI1k6aTq17DHl8U -O install-theme.sh && sudo chmod +x install-theme.sh && bash install-theme.sh && sudo rm install-theme.sh

 

Changelogs :
--------------
v0.2 : 2014-01-02
- Color match improvement
- Installation script
- Panel lightened
- CSS cleaned and commented
- Added README.txt
- workspace switcher changed
- alt-tab changed

v0.1 : 2014-01-01
- First release
 

Date : 2014-01-02
Version : 0.2

Enjoy :)
